sections.name: Kellid Graveknight
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Medium
traits.text: *Space:* 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 5 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don't benefit from healing effects.

automatic_abilities.name: Sacrilegious Aura

traits.name: Abjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the abjuration school of magic, typically involving protection or wards.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

automatic_abilities.text: When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a +23 counteract modifier.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Shove
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Shove with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Shove using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than that listed in the Damage entry. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon that is versatile S can be used to deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you make an attack.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than that listed in the Damage entry. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon that is versatile S can be used to deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you make an attack.

ability.name: Devastating Blast

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Cold
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal cold damage. Creatures with this trait have a connection to magical cold.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

ability.text: The graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of energy. Creatures in the area take 8d12 cold damage (DC 34 basic Reflex save). The graveknight can use this ability once every 1d4 rounds.

affliction.name: Graveknight's Curse
affliction.context: This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

stages.name: Stage 1
stages.text: doomed 1 and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

stages.name: Stage 2
stages.text: doomed 2, hampered 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

stages.name: Stage 3
stages.text: dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

ability.name: Repulsing Blow

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Incapacitation
traits.text: An ability with this trait can take a character completely out of the fight or even kill them, and it’s harder to use on a more powerful character. If a spell has the incapacitation trait, any creature of more than twice the spell’s level treats the result of their check to prevent being incapacitated by the spell as one degree of success better, or the result of any check the spellcaster made to incapacitate them as one degree of success worse. If any other effect has the incapacitation trait, a creature of higher level than the item, creature, or hazard generating the effect gains the same benefits.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

ability.requirement: The graveknight's last action was a success with a Strike using a shove weapon.
ability.effect: The target struck by the shove weapon is knocked back 10 feet and must succeed at a DC 33 Will save or be unable to approach within 5 feet of the graveknight for 1 round. If the last action was a critical hit, the target automatically fails the Will save.

ability.name: Weapon Master
ability.text: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.
